page.title: 17VALE OF CLWYD:CONSERVATION.
page.content: One keeper told us "There are too many cranks interfering with nature." He fears that as gamekeepers become a thing of the past, woodland songbirds will become extinct as there will be no one to act effectively against vermin such as crows,jays,magpies, foxes & squirrels. On 1 estate{ponds}have been formed out of gravel areas which have been dredged and allowed to flood in an attempt to make a{wetland {conservation area. Conifers and {hardwoods}have been planted around these ponds which now support a variety of{wild duck & heron}.On another estate, a{country lane}is left completely untouched in an attempt to encourage wild flowers + hedgerow life. On the same estate, 2 woodland areas are left in their natural state for{conservation.
